Title.evidence: This equivalence-dose randomized controlled trial evaluated whether liposomal bupivacaine provides non-inferior analgesia to the standard combination when administered via rhomboid intercostal block (RIB).

Trial_Design.evidence: In this double-blind randomized controlled trial, 90 VATS patients were randomly assigned to receive either...

Participants.evidence: 90 VATS patients were randomly assigned to receive either...

Intervention.evidence: a 20-ml premixed solution containing 93 mg of liposomal bupivacaine combined with 25 mg of plain bupivacaine (liposomal bupivacaine group), or a 20-ml admixture of 105 mg of plain bupivacaine and 5 mg of dexamethasone (plain bupivacaine with dexamethasone group).

Objective.evidence: This equivalence-dose randomized controlled trial evaluated whether liposomal bupivacaine provides non-inferior analgesia to the standard combination when administered via rhomboid intercostal block (RIB).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome assessed was the area under the curve (AUC) of the 48-h resting pain numeric rating scale (NRS).

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: In this double-blind randomized controlled trial, 90 VATS patients were randomly assigned to receive either...

Blinding.evidence: In this double-blind randomized controlled trial...

Number_Randomised.evidence: 90 VATS patients were randomly assigned to receive either...

Result_Outcome.evidence: Liposomal bupivacaine was shown to be non-inferior to plain bupivacaine with dexamethasone, with a 48-h NRS AUC of 105.5 ± 13.6 vs . 113.1 ± 16.3 (mean difference − 7.6; 95% CI − 13.9 to − 1.2, upper limit < non-inferiority margin 3.7).

Harms.evidence: Safety profiles were comparable, with no between-group differences in postoperative nausea and vomiting or other severe complications ( P > 0.05).

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered on ClinicalTrials.gov ( NCT06392191 ).
